etymologies: mid 19th century. From post-classical Latin scholasticatus (u-stem) period spent by a Jesuit in training for the priesthood, house of studies for members in the third grade of the Society of Jesus from classical Latin scholasticus + -ātus

definitions: The period spent by a Jesuit in training for ordination to the priesthood.
A Jesuit seminary or college where students are trained for ordination to the priesthood.
